title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Northern, Eastern, North-central, Uva and Southern provinces and in Matale and Nuwara-Eliya districts.

title: President AKD links Thai Pongal festival’s values to ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ initiative
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, in his Thai Pongal message, underlined the festival’s deep cultural and spiritual significance, connecting it to Sri Lanka’s broader goals of environmental and societal renewal.

title: PM Harini calls for gratitude to nature in Thai Pongal message
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya, in her message for Thai Pongal, emphasized the festival’s significance in fostering appreciation and gratitude, particularly toward nature.

title: Five acting ministers appointed during President’s state visit to China
byline: With President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s departure from the country for a State Visit to China, at the invitation of Chinese President Xi Jinping, five acting ministers have been appointed to oversee key ministries under the president’s purview.

title: Person arrested with ‘Ice’ and heroin worth Rs. 40M at Korathota
byline: Police have arrested an individual along with a stock of narcotics in the Welihinda area of Korathota, Kaduwela.

title: President Dissanayake leaves for China; Five acting ministers appointed
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has left for China this evening (13), for a four-day official state visit.

title: Derana CloseUp Music Video Awards 2024 held with grandeur
byline: “Derana CloseUp Music Video Awards 2024”, the only award ceremony celebrating Sri Lanka’s music video industry, was held recently with much glitz and glamour.

title: Top aide of impeached South Korean president pleads for investigators to halt detention efforts
byline: The top aide of impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol pleaded with law enforcement on Tuesday to abandon their efforts to detain him over last month’s martial law imposition, as authorities prepared a second attempt to take him into custody.

title: President Anura Kumara arrives in China
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who embarked on a state visit to China at the invitation of Chinese President Xi Jinping, has arrived at Beijing International Airport.

title: Sajith Premadasa emphasizes gratitude and cultural significance in Thai Pongal message
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa extended his heartfelt wishes to Tamil communities worldwide on the occasion of Thai Pongal, acknowledging the festival’s deep cultural importance and the universal value of gratitude.

title: TikTok says report of possible sale to Musk ‘pure fiction’
byline: TikTok has called a report that China is considering allowing a sale of the social media company’s US operations to Elon Musk “pure fiction.”

title: Driver injured as hospital ambulance collides with electric pole
byline: An ambulance belonging to the Rural Hospital in Wanathawilluwa has skidded off the road and collided with an electricity pole, injuring the driver of the vehicle.

title: Govt urged to implement systemic excise policy to protect people
byline: The Alcohol & Drug Information Center (ADIC) claims that due to the 20% increase in alcohol taxes in 2023, alcohol consumption has decreased by 8.3 million liters, and the government’s alcohol excise revenue has increased by Rs. 11.6 billion.

title: Abduction of schoolgirl in Kandy solely an extortion attempt, says father
byline: The schoolgirl recently abducted in the Daulagala area of Gampola has been handed over to the Daulagala Police by Ampara Police officers last night (13), along with the primary suspect.

title: Sri Lanka’s new President urged to uphold press freedom, repeal PTA and Online Safety Act
byline: As many as 25 civil society organizations including the Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch and the Committee to Protect Journalists (CPJ) have urged President Anura Kumara Dissanayake to ensure that Sri Lanka upholds press freedom and the right to freedom of expression

title: Digital NICs to be issued from this month - Deputy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Digital Economy Eranga Weeraratne states that the issuance of digital national identity cards is set to commence this month.

title: Flooding disrupts access to Somawathi Raja Maha Viharaya
byline: A section of the road leading to the Somawathi Raja Maha Viharaya in Polonnaruwa has been flooded, causing significant disruption to vehicular movement, according to police.

title: Hamas expected to release 33 hostages in first phase of emerging ceasefire deal, Israeli officials say
byline: Hamas is expected to release 33 hostages during the first phase of an emerging ceasefire agreement being finalized by negotiators in Doha, two Israeli officials said, the first positive sign in months that a truce in the Israel-Hamas war may be in sight.

title: Parliamentary staff summoned to CID over false information on Parliament website
byline: Several parliamentary officers have been summoned to the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) tomorrow (15) to provide statements regarding the inclusion of a doctorate title before the name of Minister of Justice and National Integration, Attorney-at-Law Harshana Nanayakkara, on the official Parliament website.

title: Compensation for flood-damaged crops to be paid by month-end
byline: The Agrarian Insurance Board announced that compensation for crops damaged during the floods in November last year will be disbursed by the end of this month.

title: Sydney beaches shut once again over mysterious debris washed on shore
byline: Sydney’s popular Manly Beach and other beaches around the Australian city were closed on Tuesday as authorities investigated marble-sized balls of white and gray debris that had washed on shore, in the latest such mysterious incident in recent months.
